page.title: 11 Lifestyle 1985 Con't
page.content: Entertainment was very mixed. It came in the form of theatre visits, concerts, eating out and various sporting activities, such as fishing, tennis and horse racing. However, these are all activities in which one has to travel, in some cases up to 15-20 miles, therefore a car is essential when living in this area for there are no bus services or shops. Instead mobile shops and library have to visit this village once or twice a week. There is however, a milk and postal delivery each day. Swettenham village is the proud owner of two public houses, no-one therefore goes thirsty ! Out of all the houses involved, all had electricity, water and telephone. No-one had gas because there was no pipe-line within the area.
